metadata.synopsis: Withers has just delivered the final toast, and the party will soon disband. For players who said they wanted to go with Gale and become a god - this is the moment they can choose to go with him.

5.speaker: Gale
5.text: So, it's time for me to return to the heavens.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Gale stands in front of their romanced player, smilling|NodeContext: Gale is calm and happy.

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: So, it's time for me to return to the heavens.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Gale stands in front of their romanced player, smilling|NodeContext: Gale is calm and happy.

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: Leaving already, Gale Dekarios? I think not.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: A portal appears - same as the one to House of Hope in Lower City - and Raphael steps out, in his human form. He stands before Gale and the player, with a smile on his face

67.text: Leaving already, Gale Dekarios? I think not.
67.context: NodeContext: amused, thinks he has the winning hand

13.speaker: Raphael
13.text: Leaving already, Gale Dekarios? I think not.
13.context: NodeContext: amused, thinks he has the winning hand

6.speaker: Raphael
6.text: You have something of mine. The Crown of Karsus.
6.context: NodeContext: simple statement of fact, he isn't expecting to be challenged on this

10.speaker: Player
10.text: He's right, Gale. We made a deal.
10.context: NodeContext: with a very slight bow - slightly teasing, but sincere in his admiration

12.speaker: Raphael
12.text: If your heroics hadn't already proven your quality, those words would. Honour is a rare commodity among mortalkind.
12.context: NodeContext: with a very slight bow - slightly teasing, but sincere in his admiration

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Rarer still among immortals, I'm afraid.
56.context: NodeContext: defiant, but with a grin

27.speaker: Player
27.text: The Crown belongs to Gale, devil. You can't have it.
27.context: NodeContext: irritated, but not raising his voice yet

9.speaker: Raphael
9.text: The Crown belongs to me. That was the agreement.
9.context: NodeContext: irritated, but not raising his voice yet

62.speaker: Gale
62.text: You're an alluring figure, Raphael. I confess, I took a liking to you the moment we met.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: We have something in common after all. Ambition.

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: But here's where we differ. You have lofty goals and the Crown is the key to them - you're desperate to get your claws on it.

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: Ambition is your bread and bloody butter.

39.speaker: Gale
39.text: But it's more than that to me. It's my domain, and I think in your case I'll bend the rules and make things a little more interesting for both of us.

51.speaker: Raphael
51.text: Do not toy with me, wizard.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: I thought you liked playing games?

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: You can have the Crown, Raphael. But you'll need to come and collect it from my realm.

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: I rather think I can. Ta-ta for now.
63.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gale clicks his fingers and Raphael poofs out of existence - Gale-style VFX magic for the vanishingNodeContext: Reference Raphael snap - HUM_M_Rig_SCENE_END_IO_RLC_SnapFingers 
Keep it sassy

1.speaker: Gale
1.text: That was immensely satisfying. I need to go and prepare for him to come knocking at my door.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Do you really want to try taking the Crown from a god, Raphael?
32.context: NodeContext: irritation creeping in, but not raising his voice

20.speaker: Raphael
20.text: I'm not going to take it. He's going to give it to me, as promised.
20.context: NodeContext: irritation creeping in, but not raising his voice

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: The question is - do you wish to go with me? To become a god at my side?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: What did you do to Raphael?

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: I hit him where he's most vulnerable - pricked his pride, and sent him back to the Hells to lick his wounds.

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: He'll be back. The question is, will he find us side by side?

64.speaker: Player
64.text: This will cure my heart... won't it?

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: Yes - it will cure your heart. You will be made perfect, as you deserve to be.

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: Zariel won't be pleased, of course, but let her try and stop us. And your revenge on her, when you finally take it, will be divine. All you have to do is come with me.
22.context: NodeContext: Not overly concerned about Zariel's threat - what devil could stand between him and his true love? Slightly selling it to Karlach, but not much - he knows she'll say yes.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: If I do, I'll no longer be a vampire spawn? I'll be cured?

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: You'll be perfect, as you deserve to be. Freed from all the petty complaints of mortality, vampirism included.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: If you're the god of Ambition, what will I become?
0.context: NodeContext: Callback to the spellteaching scene - intimate

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: That is for you to decide, my love. Ambition made me what I am. What drives you, we have yet to discover.

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: Your domain will come to you as you settle into divinity. I can't wait to see what you'll become.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I want that more than anything. I'm ready.
37.context: NodeContext: Callback to the spellteaching scene - intimate

66.speaker: Gale
66.context: NodeContext: Callback to the spellteaching scene - intimate

48.context: CinematicNodeContext: The orb on Gale's chest begins to glow, his powers manifesting. The player looks around in wonder - they're both being enveloped in a kind of magic - similar to the effect of the Weave in spellteaching, but this is Gale's magic (Different colour?)

26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magic surrounding them gathers speed, building it's own momentum. Gale takes the player's left hand with his right one.

23.speaker: Gale
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player closes their eyes. They trust him. Gale still holding the player's left hand with his rightNodeContext: Intimate, Gale holds onto the player's right hand with his left. Holding it at about waist height between them.

40.context: CinematicNodeContext: A flash of WHITE takes us from the rugged confines of camp to the eternity of the heavens. We don't see the player yet

36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale still close to the player, still holding player's left hand with his rightNodeContext: Same as "Close your eyes." - Gale holds onto the player's right hand with his left. Holding it at about waist height between them.

60.speaker: Gale
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale still close to the player, still holding player's left hand with his rightNodeContext: Same as "Close your eyes." - Gale holds onto the player's right hand with his left. Holding it at about waist height between them.

29.text: And that's just the beginning. I have so much more to show you...
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the player for the first time. They're no longer a mortal being, but an astral, godlike one.They let go of Gale and inspect their new form (look at hands?). Looks good. They smile at Gale.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: And that's just the beginning. I have so much more to show you...
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: not holding hands - standing in front of each otherNodeContext: Gale enthusiastic at being able to show the player more.

55.context: CinematicNodeContext: God Gale and God player kiss, arms wrapped around each other. In the astral heavens above them we see Gale's symbole flare into life. A second symbol joins it - there's a new god beside him.

18.context: CinematicNodeContext: God Gale and God player kiss, arms wrapped around each other. In the astral heavens above them we see Gale's symbole flare into life. A second symbol joins it - there's a new god beside him.

17.context: CinematicNodeContext: God Gale and God player kiss, arms wrapped around each other. In the astral heavens above them we see Gale's symbole flare into life. A second symbol joins it - there's a new god beside him.

15.context: CinematicNodeContext: God Gale and God player kiss, arms wrapped around each other. In the astral heavens above them we see Gale's symbole flare into life. A second symbol joins it - there's a new god beside him.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'm sorry, Gale. I'm not coming.
45.context: NodeContext: Genuinely deflated by this - he became a god, and you're rejecting him?

47.speaker: Gale
47.context: NodeContext: Genuinely deflated by this - he became a god, and you're rejecting him?

49.speaker: Gale
49.text: Then this is goodbye, I suppose.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale and the player share one final kiss. If there's scope - his godly powers are overwhelming for the player, who pulls away as though given an electric shock.

43.speaker: Gale
43.text: You may not wish to enter the heavens, but you do a fine job conjuring them here.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale and the player share one final kiss. If there's scope - his godly powers are overwhelming for the player, who pulls away as though given an electric shock.

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: You may not wish to enter the heavens, but you do a fine job conjuring them here.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale and the player share one final kiss. If there's scope - his godly powers are overwhelming for the player, who pulls away as though given an electric shock.

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: You may not wish to enter the heavens, but you do a fine job conjuring them here.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale and the player share one final kiss. If there's scope - his godly powers are overwhelming for the player, who pulls away as though given an electric shock.

24.text: You may not wish to enter the heavens, but you do a fine job conjuring them here.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale and the player share one final kiss. If there's scope - his godly powers are overwhelming for the player, who pulls away as though given an electric shock.

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: You may not wish to enter the heavens, but you do a fine job conjuring them here.
65.context: NodeContext: Gale's final line to the player in the game, in this flow. He still loves them.

42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale and the player share a bittersweet smile, before he exits via the same means he arrived.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I can't, I promised Astarion I'd help kill Cazador.
61.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to hide it. You chose someone else over him.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: No. I have chosen my path. I am a Warrior of the Comet.
21.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to hide it. You chose someone else over him.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I can't join you knowing that Vlaakith still oppresses my people. I'm sorry.
3.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to hide it. You chose someone else over him.

59.speaker: Gale
59.context: NodeContext: Disappointed, trying to hide it. You chose someone else over him.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I'm sorry - I promised Lae'zel my aid in Faerûn. Godhood will have to wait.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I can't. Karlach needs me in Avernus.
